column208: ""post"": ""How many times have we heard \u201cThe game is played in the trenches\u201d or \u201cIt all starts up front\u201d ?  If we only have 3 down linemen on defense and two of those are undersized that seems to be a disadvantage. If you have 2 Edge linebackers that can get around big O linemen and put pressure on or sack the QB to compensate then the 3-4 scheme can work. Wirfs and Goedeke are wooly mammoths that can stop Edge rushers. Edge rushing talent seems to be scarce. The 3-4 defense of Bowles seems too intricate and dependent on the versatility of players. If one player in the secondary gets injured and his backup lacks the same talent then the entire secondary needs to adjust. Kancey is a real talent but he needs scheme to be effective. Let\u2019s get back to a Kenworth D line and Mack trucks for linebackers.""

column2: TV Map|You poor Bucs fans in North Florida. Why does the NFL hate you so much?  The Bucs are in a win-and-in game against the slimy Saints. The stakes don’t get much bigger. Beat the slimy Saints and the Bucs host a playoff game next weekend. Lose and the season is likely over (unless former Bucs offensive coordinator Dave Canales and the Stinking Panthers do the Bucs a solid and pull off a road upset at the Dixie Chicks). So guess which part of Florida doesn’t get the Bucs game and instead is assaulted with the Jags-Colts? You’ve got it: North Florida. Surprisingly

column2: Joe hopes like heck the following doesn’t happen. We all know the Bucs are in a win-and-in game on Sunday. Beat the slimy Saints
column3: and the Bucs host a playoff game next weekend. Bbbuuuttt… lose and there is a good chance tomorrow will be the Bucs’ final game of the 2024 season. Sure
column4: the Bucs would have to pray that the Dixie Chicks lose to the Stinking Panthers at home and the Bucs could backdoor their way into the playoffs. Joe doesn’t want to think about such depressing thoughts. If the worst happens
column5: then yesterday could have been Bucs legend Lavonte David’s final practice. The 13-year vet and personification of professionalism turns 35 later this month. Last winter
column6: David toyed with hanging up his cleats but decided to return. While a few
column8: he began showing some signs of age. Just a little. But only flashes. How good has David been this year? With two sacks tomorrow
column9: he would set a career-high for sacks in a season. At age 34! “I had no idea!” David said when Joe told him about this stat. “Shoot
column10: let’s hope we can get that. I’d love to have that.” David’s current career-best is seven sacks in 2013. He currently has 5.5. Even better
column12: in the four games David has recorded a sack (or more than one)
column13: the Bucs are 4-0. “I definitely got to get one then
column14: ” David said with a smile. However
column15: that’s the fun stuff. About 2025? Joe asked David yesterday if he’s made any decision about returning in 2025 or if not
column16: when he may make a decision. “No
column19: ” David said. So he doesn’t know. When Joe asked him what the positives and negatives would be in coming back or not coming back
column20: David repeated what he said earlier. “I’m not even thinking about it.” David said he hasn’t put any thought into that because he’s so locked in with the Bucs. He’s trying to help the team get to the playoffs. After the season there will be ample time to sit down and collect his thoughts. “Trying to take care of business
column21: ” David said. David this week was named as a Pro Bowl alternate. It’s been an annual rite around these parts to be outraged by yet another snub of the Pro Bowl by the NFL community. Joe asked David if he was upset by it. In so many words
column23: who used to get upset by the annual dissing
column24: admits it doesn’t even register with him now. It seems like he has come to expect it. “It’s behind me
column26: ” David said. “It’s a blessing to be considered as an alternate
column27: but it’s all behind me. I’m older and wiser now. I’m not letting that bring me down.” His drive instead is helping the Bucs keep their season alive.|2025-01-04 08:00:00|488|23|5|Lavonte David|Lavonte David uncertain about playing in 2025.|7|Fans express admiration and hope for Lavonte David despite concerns about his future and replacements.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""Drunk Bucs Fan""

column307: ""post"": ""I was lukewarm to Mayfield in 2023.  I thought his ceiling was good but not elite.  He is elite this year.  His numbers are comparable to a typical Brady or Brees year.   His style and body type look a lot like Brees.   But Brees made lots of deep throws.   Brady had some years where he rarely made deep throws depending on his OC and WRs.  I wonder if Mayfield can improve on his deep throws.  Brees and Brady use to go to a QB guru even in their twilight years.""
